result.execSummary:
The defendant Carrie B Corcoran was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carrie B Corcoran

records.addlTxt: Cash bond from 19CF760 applied to fine and costs in 15CM412 per court record. gb/nr

Minutes:  19CF760/15CM412.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Terry Rose.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.

15CM412 - deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Deft fined $50 plus costs.  

19CF760 - deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  Deft fined $50 plus costs.  

Bond from 19CF760 shall be applied to financial obligations.  In addition, the previous forfeited cash bond of $700 shall be rescinded to cover the remaining financial obligations owed.  Any monies remaining shall remain forfeited.  

DNA ordered; written notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Rose. Clerk/H. Barnett. Deft has another case that had a substitution and went to Br 3. FP adjourned to 1/23/20 at 8:15am; Judge Wagner does not oppose Br 3 handling this case. Bond continued.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Rose. Clerk/H. Barnett. Atty Rose states the deft's case in Br 3 is not resolved and this case is also not resolved. FP continued to 11/11/19 at 1:15pm; Judge does not object to case being resolved in Br 3. Bond continued.
With ADA Krejcarek and Atty Rose, and by approval of Judge Wagner, the STC of 10/11/19 at 9:15 AM is adjourned to 11/1/19 at 8:30 AM.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Atty T Rose appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear. Clerk/H. Barnett. Court forfeits bond and issues warrant $1,000 cash bond, stayed til 10/11/19 at 9:15am.

Defendant, Carrie B Corcoran, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Attorney James Steven Kraus appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Case heard with 19CF760 today.   Not guilty plea was previously entered.   Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2019 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Terry William Rose appeared.  Attorney Emily Kay Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes: No appearance by the DE; Atty Rose has no explanation.  Court forfeits bond and orders a bench warrant for $500 cash.    958    DE appeared late. Court admonishes DE that no excuse is acceptable for not being on time for court.  Court vacates previous warrant and reinstates bond.   Further proceedings scheduled for August 7, 2019 at 8:45am.
Adjustment Number: 19A 353273, Payable Number: 288705, Receipt Number: 19R 024891, Amount: $20.00
No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Kohl's @ 7200 Green Bay Rd or Hannah W

03:26 PM 
  Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Defendant requests Jury Trial.   Further proceedings scheduled for July 24, 2019 at 09:30 am.  $500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).   jk
DE in custody and appearing today at 1pm Intake.
